docs.snippet: Gold imports in Great Britain in November amounted to [pound]3,989,267 and exports to [pound]24,440,137. Of the imports [pound]59,091 came from the Transvaal; [pound]321,262 from Rhodesia; [pound]192,082, West Africa; [pound]10,476, East Africa;...
docs.lead_paragraph: Gold imports in Great Britain in November amounted to [pound]3,989,267 and exports to [pound]24,440,137. Of the imports [pound]59,091 came from the Transvaal; [pound]321,262 from Rhodesia; [pound]192,082, West Africa; [pound]10,476, East Africa; [pound]904,856, India; [pound]343,700, Uruguay; [pound]1,275,620, Germany; [pound]376,218, Switzerland; [pound]74,322, France; [pound]36,219, Holland; and the balance from other countries.
docs.abstract: Gold shipments to and from Brit, Nov

headline.main: LONDON .EXPORTS [pound]24,440,131 GOLD; [pound]22,351,499 of the November Shipment Was Consigned to the United States

docs.snippet: Having visited, while the Eighth Pan-American Conference was in session at Lima, the three most important Latin-American Republics south of Panama-Brazil, Argentina and Chile-and the smallest, Uruguay, this correspondent is in a position to view his...
docs.lead_paragraph: Having visited, while the Eighth Pan-American Conference was in session at Lima, the three most important Latin-American Republics south of Panama-Brazil, Argentina and Chile-and the smallest, Uruguay, this correspondent is in a position to view his impressions of the four in perspective, and draw from them the following deductions:

headline.main: AMERICAS DIVIDED IN OPINION ON U. S.; Brazil Most Friendly to Us and Fearful of Nazis, Observer Finds ARGENTINA MOST HOSTILE Uruguay Plays Prudent Game--Chile Awaits Clue From New Leftist Government Reich Uses Trade Weapon Argentina Most Hostile Chileans Watch Left Regime

byline.original: By T. R. YBARRABy Air Mail to THE NEW YORK TI MES

docs.snippet: A considerable portion of the public and press of leading South American capitals has expressed the belief that the eighth Pan-American Conference, which closed at Lima, Peru, yesterday, served an unmistakable warning on Germany, Italy and Japan to...
docs.lead_paragraph: A considerable portion of the public and press of leading South American capitals has expressed the belief that the eighth Pan-American Conference, which closed at Lima, Peru, yesterday, served an unmistakable warning on Germany, Italy and Japan to keep out of the Western Hemisphere..

headline.main: VIEWS ON LIMA VARY IN LATIN AMERICA; Consensus Is That Parley Served a Clear Warning on Totalitarian States MEXICAN PAPER SKEPTICALI Sees Greatest Gain in United States' Recognition of Equality of Nations Mexican Paper Skeptical Vatican raper Laudatory Outcome "Alarms No One"

docs.snippet: The President Roosevelt of the United States Lines is due today from the Channel ports. Among her passengers are Marion Miller, F. M. Withers and E. G. Bookout. The Brazil of the American Republics Line is sailing today for f Brazil and Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: The President Roosevelt of the United States Lines is due today from the Channel ports. Among her passengers are Marion Miller, F. M. Withers and E. G. Bookout. The Brazil of the American Republics Line is sailing today for f Brazil and Argentina.
